han.definition: Used to describe the existence or relation between nouns.

hotá.definition: Used to describe the nonexistence or irrelation between nouns.

vé han.definition: Used to describe the possession of nouns.

ny.definition: Used by a speaker to refer to themself as the subject or object of a sentence.

ké.definition: Used to informally refer to a person the speaker is addressing.

téu.definition: Used to refer a person other than the speaker or addressee as the object of a sentence.

ċo.definition: Used by a speaker to refer to themself and another person as the subject or object of a sentence.

vun.definition: Used to informally refer to the people the speaker is addressing.

symi.definition: Males attaining the age of adulthood. When applied to children, it may signify their physical and/or maturity.

cévo.definition: Females attaining the age of adulthood. When applied to children, it may signify their physical and/or maturity.

náu.definition: Tall or big, especially in comparison to the subject.

mikol.definition: Short or small, especially in comparison to the subject

su.definition: used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences, that are to be taken jointly.
